Additional functions for model creation and compilation

AMICI¬∂

Model compilation

Utilities

amici_utils.define_observables()[source]¬∂

Create observables for the AMICI model

Warning

This function is an adapted copy/paste from the Jupyter Notebook

amici_utils.extract_amici_model_name()[source]¬∂

Extract the model name from the given AMICI output directory path

Note

The model name is considered to be preceded by the last ‚Äúamici‚Äù prefix found in the file path string.

Parameters:

output_dir_path ‚Äì The AMICI output directory path.

Returns:

The extracted model name.

Antimony¬∂

Main functions to generate an Antimony file

Define basic elements into an Antimony file

definitions.define_compartments()[source]¬∂

Write compartments names in the given Antimony file

Note

The dictionnary is structured as key: compartment name / value: compartment volume.

Parameters:

  • file ‚Äì The open Antimony file.

  • compartments ‚Äì Content of the input compartments file structured as specified in the __Note__ section.

Returns:

Nothing.

definitions.define_species()[source]¬∂
Write species names and affiliated compartments in the given

Antimony file

Note

First row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. First column of the array should contain species names. Second column of the array should contain species compartments.

Argurments:

file: The open Antimony file. species: Content of the input species file structured as

specified in the __Note__ section.

Returns:

Nothing.

Set initial conditions of an Antimony file

Write reactions into an Antimony file

reactions._read_reactions_species()[source]¬∂
Parameters:

  • reaction ‚Äì The reaction description.

  • formula ‚Äì The formula string.

Returns:

A tuple structured as (formula, reactants, products).

reactions.write_reactions()[source]¬∂

Write SparcedModel.Model reactions into an Antimony file

Parameters:

  • f_antimony ‚Äì The open Antimony file.

  • model ‚Äì A SpacedModel.Model.

Returns:

A tuple with the parameters‚Äô names list and the parameters‚Äô values list.

Conversion¬∂

SBML¬∂

Find location of the SBML file

creation.build_sbml_model_path()[source]¬∂

Reconstruct the path towards an SBML file

Parameters:

  • model_name ‚Äì The name of the SBML model.

  • model-path ‚Äì The path towards the SBML model‚Äôs directory.

Returns:

The path of the corresponding SBML file.

creation.get_sbml_model_path()[source]¬∂

Generate the path for an SBML file corresponding to a SparcedModel.Model object

Parameters:

model ‚Äì A SparcedModel.Model object.

Returns:

The path of the corresponding SBML file.

Annotate an SBML model

annotations.sbml_annotate_model()[source]¬∂

Annotate species and compartments of the given SBML model

Parameters:

  • file_path ‚Äì The path towards the SBML file.

  • species ‚Äì Content of the species input file.

  • compartments ‚Äì Content of the compartments input file.

Returns:

Nothing.

annotations.write_species_annotations()[source]¬∂

Set species annotations in the given SBML file

Note

First row should be the header and will be skipped. Annotations are expected to be located between the 4th and the last column of the array.

Parameters:

  • file ‚Äì The loaded SBML file.

  • species ‚Äì Content of the species input file.

Returns:

Nothing.
